doc.after: In 218 B C during the Second Punic war against the Carthaginians the first Roman troops invaded the Iberian Peninsula and annexed it under Augustus after two centuries of war with the Celtic and Iberian tribes and the Phoenician Greek and Carthaginian colonies resulting in the creation of the province of Hispania It was divided into Hispania Ulterior and Hispania Citerior during the late Roman Republic and during the Roman Empire it was divided into Hispania Taraconensis in the northeast Hispania Baetica in the south and Lusitania in the southwest
